result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary Konitzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter any taverns/bars.

Defendant must undergo anger management assesstment and follow thru with all recommendations.

Defendant must comply with all conditions outlined in 15JC-18.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary Konitzer

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mary  Konitzer in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 12:07 AM. State - - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response - resolved - amend #1 to misd neglecting a chiold contrayt 948.21(1)(a) - Class A misd - plead G as amended - joint recommendation of 1 year probation with conditions of: costs, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, anger management assessment and follow thru, 50 hours of community service, maintain/obtain full time employent/school, no contact with JK (DOB 12/18/05) except as permitted by the Court today or any protective service order that is in place (15JC18), comply with all conditions outlined in 15JC18. Laska makes statement in regards to the 15JC18, defendant is currently not working due to having a 3 month old baby and leave that condition up to P&P. Konitzer agrees and wishes to proceed today. Court amends count #1 to neglecting a child contrary to 948.21(1)(a) - reads new charge and penalty. Konitzer pleads G to count #1 as amended. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Laska makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Konitzer makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, anger management program and follow thru, 50 hours of community service, maintain/obtain full time employent/school, comply with all conditions outlined in 15JC18, submit DNA sample, costs - paid thru probation, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Jury trial on May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary  Konitzer in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:28 pm. Not resolved for stated reasons. Defense additional documents. JT date set. Bond continued. Frye has explained Frye. State recites what offer was.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Must comply with all conditions of CHIPS action and no consumption of alcohol.

Defendant Mary Konitzer in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:14 AM. Court advises of court appointed attorney - monthly payment will be assessed. Konitzer understands. Laska is willing to waive PH and enters NG plea to only count. Court goes over right to waive preliminary hearing and finds that she is intelligentiy waiving her right to PH, court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Konitzer agrees and enters her NG plea. Court imposes $1000 signaure bond - must comply with all conditions of CHIPS action and no consumption of alcohol.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
